result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan M Melcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Conditions of Extended Supervison:
Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Comply with any other assessments, treatments, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compass Assessment and the DOC
Sign release of information forms for the offender's assesment and/or treatment
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Provide DNA for testing if not already done so and pay cost
